column2: Siberian Tatar: Jauli-tora) is a town in Tyumen Oblast
column4: located on the Tobol River 75 kilometers (47 mi) southeast of Tyumen. Population: 36

column1: It was founded in 1659 as the settlement of Yalutorovsky (Ялуторовский) and was granted town status in 1782.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it serves as the administrative center of Yalutorovsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the Town of Yalutorovsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Yalutorovsk is incorporated as Yalutorovsk Urban Okrug.
